name: MIT Engineering Summer Camp for High School
description: Intensive 4-week residential program at MIT for high school students. Hands-on engineering projects in electrical, mechanical, and computer engineering. Work with MIT students and faculty on real engineering challenges.
stem_fields: Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Summer Engineering Academy
description: Three-week residential program introducing high school students to engineering disciplines. Design projects, lab work, campus tours, and college prep. Led by Stanford faculty and graduate students.

name: Carnegie Mellon Robotics Academy Summer Camp
description: One-week day camp for middle school students focused on robotics and programming. Build and program robots, learn engineering design process. Multiple sessions throughout summer.

name: Georgia Tech Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long residential and day camps for different age groups. Topics include aerospace, biomedical, civil, and computer engineering. Hands-on projects and facility tours.
stem_fields: Aerospace Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Engineering

name: iD Tech Engineering and Robotics Camps
description: Week-long camps at university locations nationwide. Engineering and robotics courses for ages 7-18. Small class sizes, personalized instruction. Day and overnight options available.

name: UC Berkeley Engineering Summer Academy
description: Two-week residential program for high school students exploring engineering fields. Laboratory experiences, design projects, and guest speakers from industry. Emphasis on diversity in engineering.

name: Purdue Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps for grades 6-12 covering various engineering disciplines. Hands-on projects, lab tours, and college preparation. Multiple camp options by age and interest.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering

name: Engineering For Kids - Summer Camps
description: Franchise-based engineering camps for ages 4-14 in communities nationwide. Week-long programs covering different engineering themes. LEGO engineering, robotics, and design challenges.

name: UT Austin Engineering Summer Academy
description: Two-week residential program introducing high school students to engineering at UT Austin. Design projects, laboratory experiences, and presentations. Explore mechanical, electrical, and chemical engineering.
stem_fields: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering

name: Michigan Tech Summer Youth Programs - Engineering
description: Week-long engineering camps for middle and high school students. Topics include civil engineering, mechanical engineering, and robotics. Hands-on projects in university labs.
stem_fields: Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Engineering

name: National Student Leadership Conference (NSLC) - Engineering
description: Multi-week residential program for high school students at university campuses. Focus on engineering leadership and career exploration. Hands-on projects and industry visits.

name: Cornell Engineering Experience for High School
description: One-week residential program exploring engineering at Cornell. Laboratory tours, hands-on projects, and college preparation workshops. Limited enrollment for personalized experience.

name: Illinois Tech Engineering Summer Program
description: Week-long day camps for Chicago-area students. Robotics, programming, and engineering design. Free or low-cost for students from underrepresented communities.

name: NASA Engineering Design Challenge Camps
description: Week-long camps at NASA visitor centers focusing on aerospace engineering. Design and test models, learn about space missions. Led by NASA educators and engineers.

name: Duke Engineering Summer Program (TIP)
description: Three-week residential program through Duke TIP for gifted students. Advanced engineering coursework and projects. College-level instruction with university credit option.

name: Penn State Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps exploring various engineering disciplines. Includes chemical, mechanical, civil, and industrial engineering options. Hands-on labs and design projects.
stem_fields: Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Industrial Engineering

name: Virginia Tech Engineering Summer Camps
description: Multiple week-long camps for grades 6-12. Topics include aerospace, biomedical, computer, and environmental engineering. Mix of design, hands-on building, and facility tours.
stem_fields: Aerospace Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Environmental Engineering

name: University of Washington Engineering Discovery Days
description: Day camps for middle schoolers exploring engineering through hands-on projects. Build bridges, design circuits, program robots. Offered throughout summer.
stem_fields: Engineering, Robotics, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering

name: Northwestern CTD Engineering Summer Programs
description: Gifted youth programs offering engineering courses at Northwestern. Multiple week options with advanced coursework. Residential and commuter options available.
source: Northwestern University Center for Talent Development

name: Texas A&M Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps for grades 6-12 across engineering disciplines. Hands-on projects, lab experiences, and team challenges. Multiple sessions throughout summer.

name: University of Michigan Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps exploring engineering fields through hands-on activities. Includes biomedical, computer, and environmental engineering options. University lab access.
stem_fields: Biomedical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Environmental Engineering

name: Johns Hopkins Engineering Innovation
description: Intensive pre-college engineering program for rising seniors. Four-week residential course covering engineering fundamentals. Team design project and college credit opportunity.

name: Cooper Union Summer STEM Program
description: Free six-week program for NYC high school students. Intensive engineering coursework, design projects, and career exploration. Focus on underrepresented students.

name: Cal Poly Engineering Summer Camps
description: Hands-on engineering camps at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. Week-long programs covering aerospace, computer, and mechanical engineering. Learn-by-doing approach.
stem_fields: Aerospace Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering

name: Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI) - Frontiers Program
description: Two-week residential STEM program for rising 12th grade girls. Engineering and computer science projects, college preparation, and mentorship from women in STEM.

name: University of Colorado Boulder Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps for grades 6-12 exploring engineering disciplines. Hands-on labs, design challenges, and team projects. Multiple themes throughout summer.

name: NC State Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long day camps for grades 6-12 across engineering fields. Includes textile, aerospace, biomedical, and civil engineering options. University lab experiences.
stem_fields: Textile Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering

name: USC Viterbi Engineering Summer Programs
description: Multi-week residential program for high school students at USC. Engineering exploration, college prep, and design projects. Access to university facilities and mentors.

name: Rose-Hulman Operation Catapult
description: Three-week residential engineering research program for rising seniors. Students conduct real engineering research with faculty mentors. Intensive hands-on experience.

name: University of Maryland Engineering for HS Students
description: Week-long camps exploring engineering at UMD. Multiple topics including aerospace, robotics, and environmental engineering. Design challenges and lab experiences.
